text:
We have Apache 2.0.52 with OpenSSL running on Windows 2000 server acting as
reverse proxy to enable HTTPS for an HTTP client. The server side is a Cisco
11500 switch with SSL module. Apache has the following global setting:

SSLSessionCache dbm:logs/ssl_scache
SSLSessionCacheTimeout 300

And on the Cisco switch similar settings:

     Session Cache Timeout:         300     SSL Version:  SSL and TLS
     Re-handshake Timeout:          0       Re-handshake Data:            0

The Cisco switch is configured to perform client authentication.

We found that Apache acting as SSL client does not reuse SSL session IDs.
Sniffer capture showed that it does not offer a session ID in Client Hello
(Session ID field length 0), and therefore CSS is not able to reuse any cached ID. 

Meanwhile, the ssl_cache file size is always zero.
creator: xiaoqing.zhu@convergys.com
mads@apache.org
text:
That is to be expected - SSLSessionCache is for mod_ssl and in specific when
Apache is the SSL server, not as a client.
If anything, you should file a feature request.
